title: 1000 Doors
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In a room there is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" doors and each  door is numbered "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Initially all the doors are closed. In a group of 1000 people each one of them is also numbered "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Person with numbered 1 goes inside the room and opened all the doors, person with numbered 2 then goes next and closed all the doors which are multiple of two. In general, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r^{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" person changes the state of those doors having multiple of r. All the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" person does the same. After this practice how many doors will be remain opened "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"?"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"NOTE","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" : A person doesn't touch other doors which are not multiple of his number"}]}]}
